intro: Hoppia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hoppia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as scrublands and coastal areas. Hoppia angustifolia is valued for its medicinal properties, with traditional uses including the treatment of respiratory ailments. Its growth habit and chemical composition make it an interesting subject for botanical and pharmacological research.
